dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, uh, fertilizers, right? They're totally essential for feeding billions of people, but they come with a pretty heavy environmental cost.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And that hydrogen, I mean, that's the key here, right? They're combining it with nitrogen to create ammonia. Which is, you know, fertilizer.

dialogue_turns.text: No idea at all? Wow. And then they stumbled upon methane pyrolysis â€“ heating natural gas without oxygen to split it.

The heat forces the molecules to split up into carbon on one hand and hydrogen gas on the other.
